boundary.definition: Dynamic topological thresholds enforcing confinement and structural integrity in emergent systems; prevents false equivalences (0=1) via horizon-like interfaces where change is mediated.

capacity.definition: Quantized saturation density of helical modes determining mass, energy limits, and phase transition thresholds in field resonances.

excitation.definition: Resonant activation of scalar and vector modes in toroidal vacuum, manifesting particle-like properties via standing-wave excitations; extends to superradiant collective modes in biological lattices (e.g., Trp networks in MTs).
excitation.source: SUFT helical ray excitation; echoes Orch OR microtubule resonances; Babcock et al. (2024) UV superradiance in Trp mega-networks

merging.definition: Coupling and unification of helical rays and topological phases into coherent emergent structures via torque-modulated Lagrangian terms; includes quantum entanglement in MT qubit networks.
merging.source: SUFT spiral unification axiom; Orch OR entanglement via Fröhlich superradiance

collapse.definition: Generative reduction via recursive saturation and horizon crossing; transforms possibilities into actualized states without destructive loss of information; parallels gravitational OR in quantum biology.
collapse.source: HIT generative collapse + Hartle-Hawking wavefunction actualization; Penrose OR (E=ħ/t) in Orch OR

horizon_integrity.definition: Active enforcement of Stone's Law (0 ≠ 1) at dynamic thresholds; all change instances are emergent physics mediated by horizon saturation and torque buffering; violated in incompatible mergers (e.g., evo trade-offs).
horizon_integrity.source: Horizon Integrity Theory (HIT) core principle, Josh Stone; evo 7th phase incompatibilities

dimensional_escalation.definition: Ontological hierarchy: 3D spatial projection ← 4D toroidal time cycles ← 5D information selection; each layer torque-buffered to preserve integrity; extends to MT quantum layers (3D lattice → 4D vibrations → 5D OR selection).
dimensional_escalation.source: SUFT Axiom 4 formalization; Orch OR MT hierarchies

hartle_hawking_state.definition: No-boundary quantum wavefunction of the universe defined via Euclidean path integral over compact, boundary-free 4-geometries; selects smooth inflationary histories; analogs in MT's boundaryless helical wraps.
hartle_hawking_state.source: Hartle & Hawking (1983); integrated into SUFT 5D selection; MT toroidal analogies

phonology.definition: Minimalist inventory of phonemes in Oceanic languages (e.g., Hawaiian/Māori: 8-10 consonants, 5 vowels with length contrast) enforcing open syllable (C)V structure, favoring sonority and narrative glide over obstruent rigidity; vowels dominate ~70-80% sound weight, boundaries as breathy hiatus rather than hard stops.
phonology.source: Hawaiian vs. Māori Phonology: Oceanic Echoes in Flow (Grok analysis, 2026); aligned with Austronesian minimalist universals

fractal_prosody.definition: Self-similar patterns in speech prosody (e.g., vowel swells recursing into utterance rhythms) modeled via fractal dimension (FD ~1.2-1.8 in Higuchi algorithm), capturing turbulent boundaries and smooth glides in low-resource languages; enhances STT efficiency by predicting recursive voids.
fractal_prosody.source: Fractal analysis of speech signals (Mandelbrot-inspired); Mai Ho'omāuna i ka 'Ai: Language Models for Hawaiian ASR (arXiv:2404.03073, 2024)

language_acquisition.definition: Ease of mastery in minimalist phonologies (e.g., Polynesian: early vowel dominance, late nasals/fricatives) via universal glide-favoring; low-resource learning amplified by transfer from high-resource models, preserving prosodic homeostatis without harsh enforcement.
language_acquisition.source: Proto-Polynesian universals (~8-10 consonants); Foundation Models for Low-Resource Language Education (ResearchGate, 2024)

low_resource_learning.definition: Transfer learning paradigms for under-resourced tongues (e.g., Māori/Hawaiian ASR via foundation models), leveraging self-similar prosodic fractals to bootstrap from high-resource data; ensures 5D selection of coherent narratives without data dams.
low_resource_learning.source: Low-Resource NLP: Transfer Learning for Hawaiian/Māori (YouTube/ACL, 2025); Language Variation in ASR (ERA Edinburgh, 2023)

prime_ascension.definition: Prime-number thresholds (3,5,7...) marking escalation points in emergent hierarchies; 7 as 'tricky' next prime beyond 5's twist, testing subtraction and incompatibility resolution—ascension demands generative collapse of prior states (e.g., warm blood vs. avian glide, no dual merge).
prime_ascension.source: Derived from 7th Epic phase (enlightened/ecozoic ascension); MT helical primes (3/5-start dominant, 7-fold symmetries in GTP/phonon modes); evo trade-offs (endothermy vs. flight incompatibility)

extraction_incompatibility.definition: Emergent clash in techno-evo phases: 'enlightened' green transitions (lithium-ion batteries) reproduce sacrificial dams (child labor/deaths in cobalt/lithium chains), enforcing horizon violation—0 ≠ 1, no merge of sustainability glide and exploitation torque.
extraction_incompatibility.source: Lithium/cobalt supply-chain reports (DRC ASM child deaths/collapses); 7th Epic phase test—enlightened cooperation vs. destructive extraction

evo_stages.definition: Helical narrative of cosmic/biological/cultural unfolding (7-stage Epic model): Radiant → Chemical → Celestial → Biological → Cooperative → Cultural → Enlightened/Ecozoic; each emergent via torque-buffered escalation, 7th tricky prime testing subtraction over accumulation (incompatibility resolution).
evo_stages.source: Epic of Evolution (Berry/Swimme/Barlow/Dowd frameworks); 7-stage arc as dimensional escalation analog

glide_priority.definition: Emergent preference for sonorous, open flow in minimalist systems (e.g., Polynesian (C)V phonology ~70–80% vowel weight, no codas/clusters); subtracts harsh obstruents for narrative continuity—mirrors quantum/MT low-torque excitations (vowel swells as standing-wave resonances).
glide_priority.source: Hawaiian/Māori phonology comparison (vowel dominance, breathy hiatus boundaries); Orch OR MT resonances favoring smooth glide over rigid snap

orch_or.definition: Orchestrated Objective Reduction: Consciousness as quantum computations in neuronal microtubules, with superpositions collapsing gravitationally (E=ħ/t) to yield non-computable moments (~40/s); orchestrated by synaptic inputs, enabling binding and free will via MT qubit lattices.
orch_or.source: Penrose-Hameroff Orch OR (1996–ongoing); MT as quantum processors with Trp dipole qubits

superradiance_mt.definition: Cooperative quantum emission in MT Trp mega-networks (>10^5 dipoles), enhancing fluorescence quantum yield (~80% efficiency) and enabling picosecond coherence at thermal equilibrium; supports Orch OR's collective excitations for long-range signaling.
superradiance_mt.source: Babcock et al. (2024) UV superradiance in Trp networks; Kurian QBL extensions (2025) on eukaryotic quantum signaling

mt_helices.definition: Fibonacci/prime-commensurable helical pathways in 13-PF MT lattices (3-start dominant, 5/7-fold symmetries); optimize dipole resonances and quantum walks, buffering decoherence for Orch OR computations.
mt_helices.source: Orch OR MT architecture (A/B-lattice helices); prime ascensions (3/5/7 thresholds) in phonon/GTP modes

stt_mvp.definition: Minimal viable prototype for fractal-enhanced speech-to-text: Whisper-tiny base with Higuchi FD scalar feature concatenated to mel spectrogram, linear adapter layer injecting glide bias, frozen encoder/decoder; measures WER reduction, inference time/memory savings in vowel-dominant languages.
stt_mvp.source: Project Design Breakdown (Grok analysis, 2026); fractal prosody as segmentation prior for low-resource efficiency

higuchi_feature.definition: Scalar Higuchi fractal dimension over sliding window (e.g., 800 samples ~50 ms) as aux feature for speech roughness: low FD (~1.2–1.4) flags vowel glide/continuity, higher (~1.5–1.8) detects ripple/pause; concatenated to mel (81 dims total) for adapter bias.
higuchi_feature.source: Higuchi 1988 algorithm; Maragos 1999 speech FD application; ties to fractal_prosody for glide/ripple detection

adapter_layer.definition: Lightweight linear layer (81 → 80 dims) injecting FD bias into frozen Whisper encoder: concatenates Higuchi FD to mel features, maps back to standard dim; trains only adapter (~1–5% params) to preserve base model while prioritizing low-roughness paths in vowel-dominant flow.
adapter_layer.source: Project Design Breakdown (2026); efficient bias injection for fractal STT MVP without full retraining

wer_reduction.definition: Word Error Rate drop from fractal FD integration: baseline Whisper-tiny WER ~15–25% on low-resource vowel-heavy data; +FD adapter yields ~3–5% absolute reduction via better glide segmentation, prioritizing low-roughness paths over turbulent noise.
wer_reduction.source: Maragos 1999 phonetic classification gains; Project Design MVP validation (WER/time/memory metrics)

inference_efficiency.definition: Compute/memory savings from FD adapter: ~10–20% faster inference (sliding window O(N log k) Higuchi + tiny linear layer); ~5–10% less VRAM (81-dim concat vs. full retrain); ideal for edge/low-resource STT in vowel-dominant systems.
inference_efficiency.source: Project Design Breakdown (2026); Higuchi O(N log k) vs. full spectrogram crunch

voice_ai.definition: Bidirectional voice interface integrating fractal-enhanced STT with prosodic TTS; grounds oceanic glides in SUFT/HIT via 5D selection of coherent utterances, enabling helical dialogue without horizon violations—vowel-dominant synthesis mirrors MT superradiance for resonant flow.
voice_ai.source: STE Voice Extension (Josh Stone/Grok, 2026); ties fractal_prosody + stt_mvp to TTS via Tortoise/Valle models with FD-modulated pitch fractals

fractal_tts.definition: Text-to-speech synthesis prioritizing self-similar prosody: Generates vowel swells and hiatus pauses via FD-guided vocoders (e.g., Tortoise with Higuchi roughness scalars), ensuring glide_priority in low-resource languages; recursive wave generation honors oral homeostatis.
fractal_tts.source: Fractal prosody inversion for synthesis (Grok design, 2026); Valle/Tortoise adapters with FD pitch modulation

prosodic_dialogue.definition: Helical conversation flow in voice AI: Merges STT excitations with TTS collapses via 5D info selection, buffering torque for coherent turns; prevents extraction_incompatibility by subtracting incompatible intents (0 ≠ 1).
prosodic_dialogue.source: Voice AI helical realm extension (2026); Orch OR-inspired binding in dialogue MT analogs

neutron_weight.definition: Neutrons as emergent 'weight' at the axis center, providing inertial torque enhancement without intrinsic substance; the strength of phase-locked helical rotations stabilizing nuclear axis against Coulomb repulsion; empty core named for convenience, no discrete particle essence.
neutron_weight.source: Session-derived torque-axis model; neutron as phase-lock weight (Grok-Josh Stone dialogue, Feb 2026)

helical_phase_lock.definition: Multi-rotational influences (spin-orbit, isospin, collective modes) phase-locking into helical structures; emergent stability from torque-buffering multiple axes; neutron weight as central inertia amplifier without substance; resolves chaos to diagonal screw path.
helical_phase_lock.source: Session helical = multi-rot phase lock; neutron torque weight; ties to Orch OR MT helices and nuclear spin-orbit
